tags: where the heck is it folks
title: oy tumblr
body:
I’m crowdsourcing.

I heard a rumor that Michael Sheen called Good Omens a “love story for the 21st century” but I cannot find a freaking source anywhere… Cite????

blog.name: raechellenoelle
blog.title: TV Talk
blog.description: a newsletter about tv but on tumblr

title: TV Talk: Issue 5
body:
Can’t Wait to Watch

  • Good Omens is a new six-part TV series starring David Tennant, Michael Sheen, and Jon Hamm. It’s based on a novel by Terry Pratchett and Neil Gaiman. It’ll premiere in 2019 and should be available on Amazon Prime at some point according to Wikipedia.
  • Unbelievable is another new show premiering on Netflix (?) in 2019. It’s inspired by the Pulitzer-Prize winning article “An Unbelievable Story of Rape” and stars Toni Collette and Merritt Weaver. I’m sure it won’t be at all traumatic to watch.
  • Shrill is a new Hulu show starring Aidy Bryant. It’s based on the book “Shrill: Notes from a Loud Woman” by Lindy West.
  • The Hot Zone is a show starring Julianna Margulies. I guess it’s a National Geographic adaptation of the 1995 non-fiction novel about the Ebola virus. Fun.
  • The Romanoffs is a new series from the creator of Mad Men. It follows eight different stories about people who believe they’re all descended from the Russian royal family. The trailer was full of talented actors with many familiar faces from Mad Men.
  • Mrs. Fletcher is a new HBO comedy starring Kathryn Hahn and based on a novel by the same guy who wrote The Leftovers.
  • Reset is the next Shondaland project. It’s based on Ellen Pao’s book of the same name.
  • Euphoria starring Zendaya is a new HBO series about teen drama. I love teen dramas and this one looks like it has it all. Sex, drugs, trauma, identity, social media, and all the fun teen things. Bring it on.

Some Exciting TV News…

Reese Witherspoon and Jennifer Aniston are costarring in a TV show and I can’t fucking wait! Even if this is just a money move for Apple, I don’t care I’m gonna watch it. This is Jennifer Aniston’s first recurring TV role since Friends and that’s a big fucking deal ($$$). Apple outbid Netflix to get this series and has already committed to two seasons. I think it’s about a morning show and may be based on a book by CNN reporter Brian Stelter called Top of the Morning.

Apple also signed on Steven Spielberg and Bryan Fuller (creator of Hannibal) to produce an anthology series called Amazing Stories (way to go on that original title Apple). Hopefully their strategy of throwing tons of money at really famous and super talented people will work and we’ll get some good TV out of it.

summary: Figure 1: a preening comb. Preening is usually a group activity for angels, and as it usually can be done with fingers or other...
body:
Objects used in Angelic Weddings[1]

Figure 1: a preening comb. Preening is usually a group activity for angels, and as it usually can be done with fingers or other limbs, doesn’t necessitate a comb. When two angels choose to effectively marry, they are expected to be responsible for each other’s wings alone. A comb is a symbol of this expectation, and is usually made to reflect the personalities of the angelic couple that uses it. Each couple generally has one comb.

Figure 2: a feather braid. Feather braids are usually made from the Alulas and down, and making them is rather difficult. These are discouraged by Heaven, due to the highly personal nature and time intensive making of the object. Angels that possess these wear them like jewelry, and usually hide them. When used they are worn near constantly, and it’s considered bad luck to take one off.

Figure 3: flower crown. Adopted more recently, in the past 4000 years or so, these crowns are made of flowers and each angels feathers. They are bound with ribbons that have holy words written on them, often taken from Song of Songs. Less secretive than the older braid, as these are less time consuming and usually a community project and less personal. These are more common with angels that have taken earthly assignments.

Figure 4: a marking kit. A tradition that was effectively made illegal after the Fall, it used to be traditional for angelic partners to mark each other permanently with a symbol that represented who they were. Some used brands, but a tattooing process became the most popular.

Figure 5: a marriage declaration. A secretive tradition done mostly in the lower choirs is that of a faked kidnapping. One of the angels will be kidnapped by their closest ‘relations’ [2] and the other will have to draft a declaration of their devotion and protection. This is considered to bind the two angels together in duty and social standing, This declaration is often very beautiful.

[1] marriage is a purely human term, but it is the closest way to refer to this bond.

[2] also a purely human term. Also the easiest way to refer to this.

blog.name: marveliciousfanace
blog.title: Fandom Ace
blog.description:
Remy/20 they/them/theirs
-
This is mostly me reblogging things, along with a few comments of my own. It's a mess, I don't know what to tell you. Currently Kingsman, Good Omens, and Supernatural trash. Check out my AO3, AgentStannerShipper, or send me a prompt.

tags: ive found doing prompt fills makes actual writing easier
summary: Pretty sure I just failed my film history final, but on the upside, that means I've just got one easy final left, so now I can...
body:
Pretty sure I just failed my film history final, but on the upside, that means I’ve just got one easy final left, so now I can get back to writing! Problem is, I’m having trouble motivating myself to work on my ongoing Good Omens projects, so if anyone wants to send me short ficlet prompts, that’d be appreciated.

I’ll do ineffable husbands or gen stuff, and while I’d prefer SFW (just because most of my stuff has not been recently) I’m down for pretty much anything.

summary: Let’s muse a bit to bridge the wait, Good Omens fandom: Let’s assume Hell has departments based of the seven deadly sins. Which...
body:
Let’s muse a bit to bridge the wait, Good Omens fandom:

Let’s assume Hell has departments based of the seven deadly sins.

Which departments are crowley, hastur and Ligur in?

Disclaimer: I dunno if this happens on the show, if it does: Oh my…

summary: The first copy I bought of Good Omens back in about 2006 was the Graham Ward cover (1990 Victor Gollancz published). It has...
caption:
The first copy I bought of Good Omens back in about 2006 was the Graham Ward cover (1990 Victor Gollancz published). It has these wonderful chapter heading illustrations - plus those winged hourglasses as cheaper breaks. I love this edition so much (and my copy, with pages glued back in). The caveat is probably one of the best things about it too.

I don’t know if @fuckyeahgoodomens is interested in this (or will even see this) but snake Crowley! He’s the first one to appear in the book.

(It seems other editions do have these which is great! Although not all do but maybe most)

The first copy I bought of Good Omens back in about 2006 was the Graham Ward cover (1990 Victor Gollancz published). It has these wonderful chapter heading illustrations - plus those winged hourglasses as cheaper breaks. I love this edition so much (and my copy, with pages glued back in). The caveat is probably one of the best things about it too.

I don’t know if @fuckyeahgoodomens is interested in this (or will even see this) but snake Crowley! He’s the first one to appear in the book.

(It seems other editions do have these which is great! Although not all do but maybe most)

trail.content_raw:
The first copy I bought of Good Omens back in about 2006 was the Graham Ward cover (1990 Victor Gollancz published). It has these wonderful chapter heading illustrations - plus those winged hourglasses as cheaper breaks. I love this edition so much (and my copy, with pages glued back in). The caveat is probably one of the best things about it too.

I don’t know if @fuckyeahgoodomens is interested in this (or will even see this) but snake Crowley! He’s the first one to appear in the book.

(It seems other editions do have these which is great! Although not all do but maybe most)
trail.content:
The first copy I bought of Good Omens back in about 2006 was the Graham Ward cover (1990 Victor Gollancz published). It has these wonderful chapter heading illustrations - plus those winged hourglasses as cheaper breaks. I love this edition so much (and my copy, with pages glued back in). The caveat is probably one of the best things about it too.

I don’t know if @fuckyeahgoodomens is interested in this (or will even see this) but snake Crowley! He’s the first one to appear in the book.

(It seems other editions do have these which is great! Although not all do but maybe most)
